page.title: 18Changing Monmouth
page.content: {Monmouth District Council}has prepared a{consultative document}which proposes {changes}in the town of Monmouth. {Traffic}congestion is seen as a problem although it is not intended to {pedestrianize}all the town centre. The Monnow Bridge area though would, the planners contend, benefit from such an arrangement. There is approx 1,350 parking spaces in the town which should be added to.New proposals include: commercial use of the{old slaughter house arches, extend{Agincourt Square}street market, which is already an attractive area. By far the biggest development suggested thus far is to transform the old{'bus station}into a{shopping {precinct.}This would include a large supermarket. The unit might have its own parking and other amenities.
